text: From the icon alone I’d vote for 3 <@UB690RZA7> But I’d love to seem some nice type to go along with that lovely icon.
Agree! Be great to get some designers involved in the voting process if possible, gain a different perspective :slightly_smiling_face:
I’ve got to say the more I look at <@UB690RZA7> icon the more I like it. The hidden CS is really great. You guys need to vote for this!
here's a version with text <@U9MAWTESW> & <@UGMGP7A72>
This wins!
my ONlY pick would be to have the text underneath finish below the end T
is there a version where the space between the upper part of the c an the lower part is als orange? i mean where the charakters are not intermittend?
this might help with readability, i have a hard time to recognize the letters, but i did have it with the SUN Logo as well
I don’t think adding orange would make that more readable since the C is orange.
i might be misunderstanding however
i think both front runners are great options.
<@U7TAZ6V2Q> I think this ones right up your alley

Logos are fun and its a great motivator to see something come alive.  Just keep in mind the logo for a framework will hold little weight in the long run. Lets not get too wrapped up in the visual identity, the success lies with the code.  That being said I like all the options and think any of them would be a solid choice.
<@UB690RZA7> for the WIN
<@UGMGP7A72> i still think poll will decide the winner.
<@U7AS8L4MR> I think the icon in <@UB690RZA7> logo is really good. I wouldn’t mind seeing it alongside your type

once the poll closes and we settle on a general direction, i think then we can suggest any modifications to the type and colors.  So we don’t waste time creating several frankensteins of every option we have.

<@U7AS8L4MR> is completely correct. We’ll let the poll decide the winner, and I want everyone to know if you submitted designs. Seriously that is awesome, and your work is very much appreciated. The 2 front runner logos are both awesome and take into account feedback and ideas pulled from the other logos. The way I see it, none of the work was wasted, some aspect of another person’s design and community feedback got incorporated in some way into the more final versions of the logos.

As Ike said, the logo is a banner to rally under but it’s not what will make the framework a framework, there is a ton of opportunity to contribute through code, and documentation.

I plan to try to document everyone who contributed a logo in some way, and everyone who voted in the poll, so credit will be given to everyone.

Love it! This got my vote.  Only concern is text beneath is a little hard to read. Maybe use 2 lines?
OPEN SOURCE HubSpot
DEVELOPMENT FRAMEWORK
<@U7TAZ6V2Q> has great taste.
Id like to see this in a negative inside a square
<@U2H3TT8F2> is rockin’ it with chiming in on issues on the github
Once I finish our Agency’s new site, i’ll be able to spare more time/brainpower lol

*2 actions everyone can take that don’t even require touching code, or working in git, and only take a few seconds.*
<https://github.com/TheWebTech/CrankShaft/issues/43>

done! Also not sure if I made it in time for the poll but I voted anyway...

I want to be fair regarding the logo, I also don’t want to keep dragging it out, Everyone feel good about calling it? it’s 2.5 hours past noon CST  there was an update to Tony’s that came in after the poll started. <@U7AS8L4MR>’s logo won the poll by 6 votes.

I feel it’s still pretty close but we’re definitely down to just those 2.

*What’s everyone think?* I don’t really want to keep re-polling on the logo drawing it out, but I want to be fair.
let's have a duel between the two finalists

as someone who just came into it today, it did get pretty confusing trying to keep track of what was being voted on or not...I vote to call it on the top ones as-is and then update the winner as needed
a duel!?

lol <@UD53A9UUR> we could use that script from your module, to make it so there’s easy light/dark theme support in crankshaft.

if the dev wanted to use it they’d toggle a boolean in theme-settings, user preference would trigger a class on the html element, that could be styled against.

Simply add the html and class name for toggle, voila easy darktheme support. the dev just has to add their own styling for what dark/light theme should look like
Yeah!
